column1: Authenticated via customer login (email + password). Each customer can only access their own data.
column2: Authenticated via customer login (email + password). Each customer can only access their own data.

column1: Check to generate new client_id and client_secret. The old credentials will stop working.
column2: Check to generate new client_id and client_secret. The old credentials will stop working.

column1: Date when legacy SOAP/REST APIs will be disabled
column2: Date when legacy SOAP/REST APIs will be disabled

column1: GraphQL Standard uses camelCase (recommended). Magento 2 uses snake_case for compatibility with M2 themes.
column2: GraphQL Standard uses camelCase (recommended). Magento 2 uses snake_case for compatibility with M2 themes.

column1: Leave blank to keep the current key.
column2: Leave blank to keep the current key.

column1: No permissions needed. This matches how Shopify and Magento 2 expose catalog data.
column2: No permissions needed. This matches how Shopify and Magento 2 expose catalog data.

column1: OAuth2 client_id and client_secret will be generated when you save this user.
column2: OAuth2 client_id and client_secret will be generated when you save this user.

column1: Please enable API Platform in System > Configuration > Services > API Platform
column2: Please enable API Platform in System > Configuration > Services > API Platform

column1: Save these credentials now. The secret cannot be retrieved later.
column2: Save these credentials now. The secret cannot be retrieved later.

column1: These operations use customer JWT tokens obtained when a customer logs in. They are scoped to the logged-in customer's own data and cannot be granted to service accounts.
column2: These operations use customer JWT tokens obtained when a customer logs in. They are scoped to the logged-in customer's own data and cannot be granted to service accounts.

column1: These permissions control what API users (service accounts) can do. Grant only the operations each integration needs — e.g. a shipping provider needs Orders (View) + Shipments (Create), a CMS tool needs Content Management access.
column2: These permissions control what API users (service accounts) can do. Grant only the operations each integration needs — e.g. a shipping provider needs Orders (View) + Shipments (Create), a CMS tool needs Content Management access.

column1: These resources are publicly readable without authentication. Any visitor or app can access this data via GET requests.
column2: These resources are publicly readable without authentication. Any visitor or app can access this data via GET requests.

column1: This API user no longer exists.
column2: This API user no longer exists.
